cards.name: Environmental Sciences
cards.text: Search your library for a basic land card, reveal it, put it into your hand, then shuffle. You gain 2 life.
cards.flavor: First-years quickly learn how the Vastlands earned its name.

cards.name: Expanded Anatomy
cards.text: Put two +1/+1 counters on target creature. It gains vigilance until end of turn.
cards.flavor: "Changing the equation from incremental to exponential was a stroke of genius on my part."

cards.name: Introduction to Annihilation
cards.text: Exile target nonland permanent. Its controller draws a card.
cards.flavor:
"I've never seen a student fail quite so spectacularly. There's potential in that."
-Hostram, professor of arcanochemistry

cards.name: Introduction to Prophecy
cards.text: Scry 2, then draw a card.
cards.flavor: Final grades are posted on the first day of class.

cards.name: Mascot Exhibition
cards.text: Create a 2/1 white and black Inkling creature token with flying, a 3/2 red and white Spirit creature token, and a 4/4 blue and red Elemental creature token.
cards.flavor:
"Don't just win the game. Win the crowd."
-Moriana, Mage Tower coach

cards.name: Wandering Archaic
cards.text: Whenever an opponent casts an instant or sorcery spell, they may pay {2}. If they don't, you may copy that spell. You may choose new targets for the copy.
cards.flavor: "Fly the path of nine birds."

cards.name: Explore the Vastlands
cards.text: Each player looks at the top five cards of their library, reveals a land card and/or an instant or sorcery card from among them, then puts the cards they revealed this way into their hand and the rest on the bottom of their library in a random order. Each player gains 3 life.

cards.name: Academic Probation
cards.text:
Choose one -
• Choose a nonland card name. Opponents can't cast spells with the chosen name until your next turn.
• Choose target nonland permanent. Until your next turn, it can't attack or block, and its activated abilities can't be activated.

cards.name: Ageless Guardian
cards.flavor: Ancient ruins dot the world of Arcavios, most older than Strixhaven itself and many still guarded by soldiers from the Blood Age, centuries after their deaths.

cards.name: Beaming Defiance
cards.text: Target creature you control gets +2/+2 and gains hexproof until end of turn. (It can't be the target of spells or abilities your opponents control.)
cards.flavor:
"I've lived too long in my father's shadow. It's time to find my own light."
-Killian, Silverquill mage-student

cards.name: Clever Lumimancer
cards.text: Magecraft - Whenever you cast or copy an instant or sorcery spell, Clever Lumimancer gets +2/+2 until end of turn.
cards.flavor: "You're too dim to realize it, but you've already lost."

cards.name: Combat Professor
cards.text:
Flying
At the beginning of combat on your turn, target creature you control gets +1/+0 and gains vigilance until end of turn.
cards.flavor: "Before Yovus was cut down at Pranticle Peak, she performed which maneuver? Anyone? From the reading?"

cards.name: Defend the Campus
cards.text:
Choose one -
• Creatures you control get +1/+1 until end of turn.
• Destroy target creature with power 4 or greater.
cards.flavor: Professors scrambled to push the mage hunters back, leaving the heart of Strixhaven undefended.

cards.name: Detention Vortex
cards.text:
Enchant nonland permanent
Enchanted permanent can't attack or block, and its activated abilities can't be activated.
{3}: Destroy Detention Vortex. Only your opponents may activate this ability and only as a sorcery.

cards.name: Devastating Mastery
cards.text:
You may pay {2}{W}{W} rather than pay this spell's mana cost.
If the {2}{W}{W} cost was paid, an opponent chooses up to two nonland permanents they control and returns them to their owner's hand.
Destroy all nonland permanents.

cards.name: Dueling Coach
cards.text:
When Dueling Coach enters the battlefield, put a +1/+1 counter on target creature.
{4}{W}, {T}: Put a +1/+1 counter on each creature you control with a +1/+1 counter on it.

cards.name: Eager First-Year
cards.text: Magecraft - Whenever you cast or copy an instant or sorcery spell, Eager First-Year gets +1/+0 until end of turn.
cards.flavor: Today, she learns the basics. She'll knock out advanced theory later this week.

cards.name: Elite Spellbinder
cards.text:
Flying
When Elite Spellbinder enters the battlefield, look at target opponent's hand. You may exile a nonland card from it. For as long as that card remains exiled, its owner may play it. A spell cast this way costs {2} more to cast.
cards.flavor: Paulo Vitor Damo da Rosa, World Champion XXVI

cards.name: Expel
cards.text: Exile target tapped creature.
cards.flavor: Quintorius was a daydreamer, far happier digging through history books than practicing battle tactics. He agreed with the military academy on only one thing: he did not belong in their ranks.

cards.name: Guiding Voice
cards.text:
Put a +1/+1 counter on target creature.
Learn. (You may reveal a Lesson card you own from outside the game and put it into your hand, or discard a card to draw a card.)
cards.flavor: When honormancers work together, their compliments are complementary.

cards.name: Leonin Lightscribe
cards.text: Magecraft - Whenever you cast or copy an instant or sorcery spell, creatures you control get +1/+1 until end of turn,
cards.flavor: All who hear his inspiring words are filled with hope and pride.

cards.name: Mavinda, Students' Advocate
cards.text:
Flying
{0}: You may cast target instant or sorcery card from your graveyard this turn. If that spell doesn't target a creature you control, it costs {8} more to cast this way. If that spell would be put into your graveyard, exile it instead. Activate only once each turn. (You still pay the spell's costs. Timing rules for the spell still apply.)

cards.name: Pilgrim of the Ages
cards.text:
When Pilgrim of the Ages enters the battlefield, you may search your library for a basic Plains card, reveal it, put it into your hand, then shuffle.
{6}: Return Pilgrim of the Ages from your graveyard to your hand.

cards.name: Pillardrop Rescuer
cards.text:
Flying
When Pillardrop Rescuer enters the battlefield, return target creature card with mana value 3 or less from your graveyard to your hand.
cards.flavor: Gentle hands of stone whisk the careless from the crumbling ruins of Pillardrop.

cards.name: Professor of Symbology
cards.text: When Professor of Symbology enters the battlefield, learn. (You may reveal a Lesson card you own from outside the game and put it into your hand, or discard a card to draw a card.)
cards.flavor: "A language isn't dead until we stop learning from it."

cards.name: Reduce to Memory
cards.text: Exile target nonland permanent. Its controller creates a 3/2 red and white Spirit creature token.
cards.flavor:
"Do not flinch from studying the horrors of the past. History's most important lessons are cloaked in terror and tragedy."
-Augusta, Lorehold dean

cards.name: Secret Rendezvous
cards.text: You and target opponent each draw three cards.
cards.flavor: Strixhaven's five colleges encourage natural rivalries among the students, but some bonds transcend all barriers.

cards.name: Semester's End
cards.text: Exile any number of target creatures and/or planeswalkers you control. At the beginning of the next end step, return each of them to the battlefield under its owner's control. Each of them enters the battlefield with an additional +1/+1 counter on it if it's a creature and an additional loyalty counter on it if it's a planeswalker.

cards.name: Show of Confidence
cards.text:
When you cast this spell, copy it for each other instant or sorcery spell you've cast this turn. You may choose new targets for the copies.
Put a +1/+1 counter on target creature. It gains vigilance until end of turn.

cards.name: Sparring Regimen
cards.text:
When Sparring Regimen enters the battlefield, learn. (You may reveal a Lesson card you own from outside the game and put it into your hand, or discard a card to draw a card.)
Whenever you attack, put a +1/+1 counter on target attacking creature and untap it.

cards.name: Star Pupil
cards.text:
Star Pupil enters the battlefield with a +1/+1 counter on it.
When Star Pupil dies, put its counters on target creature you control.
cards.flavor: "When I'm done here, they'll name entire buildings after me."

cards.name: Stonebinder's Familiar
cards.text: Whenever one or more cards are put into exile during your turn, put a +1/+1 counter on Stonebinder's Familiar. This ability triggers only once each turn.
cards.flavor:
"Hey, my great-great-grandfather had a dog just like that!"
-Dradiel, Lorehold mage-student

cards.name: Stonerise Spirit
cards.text:
Flying
{4}, Exile a card from your graveyard: Target creature gains flying until end of turn.
cards.flavor: The carved cliffs of Pillardrop thrum with the sounds of ancient spirits rising from the past.

cards.name: Strict Proctor
cards.text:
Flying
Whenever a permanent entering the battlefield causes a triggered ability to trigger, counter that ability unless its controller pays {2}.
cards.flavor: "You might believe that being dead for centuries has made me more lenient. I think you'll find the opposite is true."

cards.name: Study Break
cards.text:
Tap up to two target creatures.
Learn. (You may reveal a Lesson card you own from outside the game and put it into your hand, or discard a card to draw a card.)
cards.flavor: "You've been cramming all night. You're taking a nap whether you like it or not."

cards.name: Thunderous Orator
cards.text:
Vigilance
Whenever Thunderous Orator attacks, it gains flying until end of turn if you control a creature with flying. The same is true for first strike, double strike, deathtouch, indestructible, lifelink, menace, and trample.

cards.name: Arcane Subtraction
cards.text:
Target creature gets -4/-0 until end of turn.
Learn. (You may reveal a Lesson card you own from outside the game and put it into your hand, or discard a card to draw a card.)
cards.flavor: The class learned little that day.

cards.name: Archmage Emeritus
cards.text: Magecraft - Whenever you cast or copy an instant or sorcery spell, draw a card.
cards.flavor: Some emeritus professors return from their wanderings periodically to share tales of the mystical wonders of Arcavios.

cards.name: Burrog Befuddler
cards.text:
Flash
When Burrog Befuddler enters the battlefield, target creature an opponent controls gets -1/-0 until end of turn.
cards.flavor: Students who seek river herbs in Doradur quickly find themselves slightly damp and thoroughly surrounded.

cards.name: Bury in Books
cards.text:
This spell costs {2} less to cast if it targets an attacking creature.
Put target creature into its owner's library second from the top.
cards.flavor: There are no weapons allowed in the Biblioplex, but a clever mage is never truly defenseless.

cards.name: Curate
cards.text:
Look at the top two cards of your library. Put any number of them into your graveyard and the rest back on top of your library in any order.
Draw a card.
cards.flavor: "Kathorran War Chants, Vol. III? That doesn't even belong in this wing!"

cards.name: Divide by Zero
cards.text:
Return target spell or permanent with mana value 1 or greater to its owner's hand.
Learn. (You may reveal a Lesson card you own from outside the game and put it into your hand, or discard a card to draw a card.)
cards.flavor: "Misery. Inadequacy. Failure. The common denominator is you."

cards.name: Dream Strix
cards.text:
Flying
When Dream Strix becomes the target of a spell, sacrifice it.
When Dream Strix dies, learn. (You may reveal a Lesson card you own from outside the game and put it into your hand, or discard a card to draw a card.)

cards.name: Frost Trickster
cards.text:
Flying
When Frost Trickster enters the battlefield, tap target creature an opponent controls. That creature doesn't untap during its controller's next untap step.
cards.flavor: The most important skill in a Mage Tower match is keeping one's cool.

cards.name: Ingenious Mastery
cards.text:
You may pay {2}{U} rather than pay this spell's mana cost.
If the {2}{U} cost was paid, you draw three cards, then an opponent creates two Treasure tokens and they scry 2. If that cost wasn't paid, you draw X cards.

cards.name: Kelpie Guide
cards.text:
{T}: Untap another target permanent you control.
{T}: Tap target permanent. Activate only if you control eight or more lands.
cards.flavor: Kelpies are drawn to paradoxes, making them ideal companions for Quandrix mages.

cards.name: Mentor's Guidance
cards.text:
When you cast this spell, copy it if you control a planeswalker, Cleric, Druid, Shaman, Warlock, or Wizard.
Scry 1, then draw a card.
cards.flavor: Kasmina had encouraged the twins to apply. Strixhaven would test not only their magical potential, but also their character.

cards.name: Mercurial Transformation
cards.text: Until end of turn, target nonland permanent loses all abilities and becomes your choice of a blue Frog creature with base power and toughness 1/1 or a blue Octopus creature with base power and toughness 4/4.
cards.flavor: "For sun's sake, I just want a crab!"

cards.name: Multiple Choice
cards.text:
If X is 1, scry 1, then draw a card.
If X is 2, you may choose a player. They return a creature they control to its owner's hand.
If X is 3, create a 4/4 blue and red Elemental creature token.
If X is 4 or more, do all of the above.

cards.name: Pop Quiz
cards.text:
Draw a card.
Learn. (You may reveal a Lesson card you own from outside the game and put it into your hand, or discard a card to draw a card.)
cards.flavor: "Today is hydromancy? I thought it was amplimancy! I studied for amplimancy!"

cards.name: Reject
cards.text: Counter target creature or planeswalker spell unless its controller pays {3}. If that spell is countered this way, exile it instead of putting into its owner's graveyard.
cards.flavor:
"Grux, for the last time, you have to do more than simply shout 'Apply!' at the administrators."
-Pavil, admissions officer

cards.name: Resculpt
cards.text: Exile target artifact or creature. Its controller creates a 4/4 blue and red Elemental creature token.
cards.flavor: Critics were struck first by the elemental's surprising grace, and then by its fists.

cards.name: Serpentine Curve
cards.text: Create a 0/0 green and blue Fractal creature token. Put X +1/+1 counters on it, where X is one plus the total number of instant and sorcery cards you own in exile and in your graveyard.
cards.flavor:
"Math bites."
-Bim, Lorehold mage-student

cards.name: Snow Day
cards.text:
Tap up to two target creatures. Those creatures don't untap during their controller's next untap step.
Draw two cards, then discard a card.
cards.flavor:
"Advanced Elemental Manifestations is canceled until all students have thawed."
-Prismari dormitory notice

cards.name: Solve the Equation
cards.text: Search your library for an instant or sorcery card, reveal it, put it into your hand, then shuffle.
cards.flavor: Zimone's brilliance drew attention from many, including the sinister mages known as the Oriq.

cards.name: Soothsayer Adept
cards.text: {1}{U}, {T}: Draw a card, then discard a card.
cards.flavor: One of the first lessons divination students learn is how to recognize the difference between a portent and a simple surface ripple.

cards.name: Symmetry Sage
cards.text:
Flying
Magecraft - Whenever you cast or copy an instant or sorcery spell, target creature you control has base power 2 until end of turn.
cards.flavor: "By my calculations, I should be able to achieve true enlightenment before graduation."

cards.name: Teachings of the Archaics
cards.text: If an opponent has more cards in hand than you, draw two cards. Draw three cards instead if an opponent has at least four more cards in hand than you.
cards.flavor: Mages seek out the ancient beings known as the Archaics for their boundless knowledge of history and magic, dispensed only in cryptic metaphors.

cards.name: Tempted by the Oriq
cards.text: For each opponent, gain control of up to one target creature or planeswalker that player controls with mana value 3 or less.
cards.flavor: To exact his vengeance, Extus needed followers. His infiltrators recruited promising mage-students from the very halls he sought to destroy.

cards.name: Test of Talents
cards.text: Counter target instant or sorcery spell. Search its controller's graveyard, hand, and library for any number of cards with the same name as that spell and exile them. That player shuffles, then draws a card for each card exiled from their hand this way.

cards.name: Vortex Runner
cards.text: As long as you control eight or more lands, Vortex Runner gets +1/+0 and can't be blocked.
cards.flavor: "By using the vortex, I can study for at least fifteen extra minutes between every class. I wasn't being reckless, Dean Imbraham. I was being efficient."

cards.name: Waterfall Aerialist
cards.text:
Flying
Ward {2} (Whenever this creature becomes the target of a spell or ability an opponent controls, counter it unless that player pays {2}.)
cards.flavor: Form and function in perfect unity.

cards.name: Wormhole Serpent
cards.text: {3}{U}: Target creature can't be blocked this turn.
cards.flavor: After drownings, devourings, and one highly unpleasant algae infestation, unsupervised portal use on campus was banned.

cards.name: Arrogant Poet
cards.text: Whenever Arrogant Poet attacks, you may pay 2 life. If you do, it gains flying until end of turn.
cards.flavor: "I would be kinder to my peers, Professor, but I simply don't have any."

cards.name: Baleful Mastery
cards.text:
You may pay {1}{B} rather than pay this spell's mana cost.
If the {1}{B} cost was paid, an opponent draws a card.
Exile target creature or planeswalker.

cards.name: Brackish Trudge
cards.text:
Brackish Trudge enters the battlefield tapped.
{1}{B}: Return Brackish Trudge from your graveyard to your hand. Activate only if you gained life this turn.
cards.flavor: Most trudges are covered with decaying plant matter, making them ideal breeding grounds for fungal spores.

cards.name: Callous Bloodmage
cards.text:
When Callous Bloodmage enters the battlefield, choose one -
• Create a 1/1 black and green Pest creature token with "When this creature dies, you gain 1 life."
• You draw a card and you lose 1 life.
• Exile target player's graveyard.

cards.name: Confront the Past
cards.text:
Choose one -
• Return target planeswalker card with mana value X or less from your graveyard to the battlefield.
• Remove twice X loyalty counters from target planeswalker an opponent controls.
cards.flavor: "Why, Gideon? Of all people, why save me?"

cards.name: Crushing Disappointment
cards.text: Each player loses 2 life. You draw two cards.
cards.flavor: Most students could barely endure Dean Embrose's scrutiny for a semester or two; Killian lived with it his entire life.

cards.name: Essence Infusion
cards.text: Put two +1/+1 counters on target creature. It gains lifelink until end of turn.
cards.flavor: "I'd say it's still a fair fight-now my friend is about the size of your ego."

cards.name: Eyetwitch
cards.text:
Flying
When Eyetwitch dies, learn. (You may reveal a Lesson card you own from outside the game and put it into your hand, or discard a card to draw a card.)
cards.flavor: Oculomancers see the ideal potion ingredient. The bats don't see it that way.

cards.name: Flunk
cards.text: Target creature gets -X/-X until end of turn, where X is 7 minus the number of cards in that creature's controller's hand.
cards.flavor:
"I assure you, no one fails my course more than once."
-Embrose, Silverquill dean

cards.name: Go Blank
cards.text: Target player discards two cards. Then exile all cards from that player's graveyard.
cards.flavor: The only feeling worse than not knowing the answer is the certainty that you once did.

cards.name: Hunt for Specimens
cards.text:
Create a 1/1 black and green Pest creature token with "When this creature dies, you gain 1 life."
Learn. (You may reveal a Lesson card you own from outside the game and put it into your hand, or discard a card to draw a card.)

cards.name: Lash of Malice
cards.text: Target creature gets +2/-2 until end of turn.
cards.flavor:
"The strongest shadow spells come from disdain for someone else, not frustration with yourself."
-Embrose, Silverquill dean

cards.name: Leech Fanatic
cards.text: As long as it's your turn, Leech Fanatic has lifelink.
cards.flavor: "Everyone thinks that leeches maintain a strictly sanguivorous diet, but in fact, most freshwater leeches are carnivores. Wait, where are you going?"

cards.name: Mage Hunter
cards.text: Whenever an opponent casts or copies an instant or sorcery spell, they lose 1 life.
cards.flavor: One of the Oriq's most powerful tools is the mage hunter, a vile monstrosity created to seek out and snuff out the arcane.

cards.name: Mage Hunters' Onslaught
cards.text:
Destroy target creature or planeswalker.
Whenever a creature blocks this turn, its controller loses 1 life.
cards.flavor: Extus stood before his alma mater for a moment, remembering his first studies, then his vengeance. At his command, the mage hunters unfolded.

cards.name: Necrotic Fumes
cards.text:
As an additional cost to cast this spell, exile a creature you control.
Exile target creature or planeswalker.
cards.flavor: When live specimens aren't readily available, Witherbloom mages make creative use of ragged spirits clinging to long-dead bodies.

cards.name: Novice Dissector
cards.text: {1}, Sacrifice another creature: Put a +1/+1 counter on target creature. Activate only as a sorcery.
cards.flavor: "The professor said to first extract the venom glands, then the acid sac. Next up, the . . . meeping organ?"

cards.name: Oriq Loremage
cards.text: {T}: Search your library for a card, put it into your graveyard, then shuffle. If it's an instant or sorcery card, put a +1/+1 counter on Oriq Loremage.
cards.flavor: Nothing can quell the Oriq's thirst for the forbidden secrets of the past.

cards.name: Plumb the Forbidden
cards.text:
As an additional cost to cast this spell, you may sacrifice one or more creatures. When you do, copy this spell for each creature sacrificed this way.
You draw a card and you lose 1 life.
cards.flavor: Strixhaven forbade all magic from the Blood Age, so that is where Extus began his research.

cards.name: Poet's Quill
cards.text:
When Poet's Quill enters the battlefield, learn. (You may reveal a Lesson card you own from outside the game and put it into your hand, or discard a card to draw a card.)
Equipped creature gets +1/+1 and has lifelink.
Equip {1}{B}

cards.name: Professor Onyx
cards.text:
Magecraft - Whenever you cast or copy an instant or sorcery spell, each opponent loses 2 life and you gain 2 life.
[+1]: You lose 1 life. Look at the top three cards of your library. Put one of them into your hand and the rest into your graveyard.
[−3]: Each opponent sacrifices a creature with the greatest power among creatures that player controls.
[−8]: Each opponent may discard a card. If they don't, they lose 3 life. Repeat this process six more times.

cards.name: Professor's Warning
cards.text:
Choose one -
• Put a +1/+1 counter on target creature.
• Target creature gains indestructible until end of turn. (Damage and effects that say "destroy" don't destroy it.)
cards.flavor: Professor Onyx urged the twins to prepare for the dark mage Extus, sounding very much like someone familiar with the rise of tyrants.

cards.name: Promising Duskmage
cards.text: When Promising Duskmage dies, if it had a +1/+1 counter on it, draw a card.
cards.flavor: "Your technique is sloppy, but there is talent there. Do it again, and keep your right arm in position this time."

cards.name: Sedgemoor Witch
cards.text:
Menace
Ward-Pay 3 life. (Whenever this creature becomes the target of a spell or ability an opponent controls, counter it unless that player pays 3 life.)
Magecraft - Whenever you cast or copy an instant or sorcery spell, create a 1/1 black and green Pest creature token with "When this creature dies, you gain 1 life."

cards.name: Specter of the Fens
cards.text:
Flying
{5}{B}: Target opponent loses 2 life and you gain 2 life.
cards.flavor: Foul specters hunt down those who try to back out of a deal with a daemogoth.

cards.name: Tenured Inkcaster
cards.text:
When Tenured Inkcaster enters the battlefield, put a +1/+1 counter on target creature.
Whenever a creature you control with a +1/+1 counter on it attacks, each opponent loses 1 life and you gain 1 life.
cards.flavor: "Ah, another future archmage for my collection."

cards.name: Umbral Juke
cards.text:
Choose one: -
• Target player sacrifices a creature or planeswalker.
• Create a 2/1 white and black Inkling creature token with flying.
cards.flavor: The sport of Mage Tower was conceived as a playful testing ground for young spellcasters.

cards.name: Unwilling Ingredient
cards.text:
Menace (This creature can't be blocked except by two or more creatures.)
{2}{B}, Exile Unwilling Ingredient from your graveyard: You draw a card and you lose 1 life.
cards.flavor:
"Don't look at me like that. It was either this or being eaten by a groff."
-Dina, Witherbloom mage-student

cards.name: Academic Dispute
cards.text:
Target creature blocks this turn if able. You may have it gain reach until end of turn.
Learn. (You may reveal a Lesson card you own from outside the game and put it into your hand, or discard a card to draw a card.)
cards.flavor: "I'll show you original research, you hack!"

cards.name: Ardent Dustspeaker
cards.text: Whenever Ardent Dustspeaker attacks, you may put an instant or sorcery card from your graveyard on the bottom of your library. If you do, exile the top two cards of your library. You may play those cards this turn.
cards.flavor: "The Founder Dragons weren't even hatched when this scroll was written!"

cards.name: Blood Age General
cards.text: {T}: Attacking Spirits get +1/+0 until end of turn.
cards.flavor: His troops took the Fortress of Caerdoon centuries ago, yet he fights on.

cards.name: Conspiracy Theorist
cards.text:
Whenever Conspiracy Theorist attacks, you may pay {1} and discard a card. If you do, draw a card.
Whenever you discard one or more nonland cards, you may exile one of them from your graveyard. If you do, you may cast it this turn.

cards.name: Crackle with Power
cards.text: Crackle with Power deals five times X damage to each of up to X targets.
cards.flavor: Will gasped as Rowan drew from the raw power of the Strixhaven Snarl. For a moment, she was luminous, transcendent, terrible.

cards.name: Draconic Intervention
cards.text:
As an additional cost to cast this spell, exile an instant or sorcery card from your graveyard.
Draconic Intervention deals X damage to each non-Dragon creature, where X is the exiled card's mana value. If a creature dealt damage this way would die this turn, exile it instead.
Exile Draconic Intervention.

cards.name: Dragon's Approach
cards.text:
Dragon's Approach deals 3 damage to each opponent. You may exile Dragon's Approach and four cards named Dragon's Approach from your graveyard. If you do, search your library for a Dragon creature card, put it onto the battlefield, then shuffle.
A deck can have any number of cards named Dragon's Approach.

cards.name: Efreet Flamepainter
cards.text:
Double strike
Whenever Efreet Flamepainter deals combat damage to a player, you may cast target instant or sorcery card from your graveyard without paying its mana cost. If that spell would be put into your graveyard, exile it instead.

cards.name: Enthusiastic Study
cards.text:
Target creature gets +3/+1 and gains trample until end of turn.
Learn. (You may reveal a Lesson card you own from outside the game and put it into your hand, or discard a card to draw a card.)
cards.flavor: "If the pen is mightier than the sword, just think what a giant tome could do!"

cards.name: Explosive Welcome
cards.text: Explosive Welcome deals 5 damage to any target and 3 damage to any other target. Add {R}{R}{R}.
cards.flavor: Rowan and Will were a natural fit in Prismari College, the school of outrageous elemental arts.

cards.name: Fervent Mastery
cards.text:
You may pay {2}{R}{R} rather than pay this spell's mana cost.
If the {2}{R}{R} cost was paid, an opponent discards any number of cards, then draws that many cards.
Search your library for up to three cards, put them into your hand, shuffle, then discard three cards at random.

cards.name: First Day of Class
cards.text:
Whenever a creature enters the battlefield under your control this turn, put a +1/+1 counter on it and it gains haste until end of turn.
Learn. (You may reveal a Lesson card you own from outside the game and put it into your hand, or discard a card to draw a card.)

cards.name: Fuming Effigy
cards.text: Whenever one or more cards leave your graveyard, Fuming Effigy deals 1 damage to each opponent.
cards.flavor: Some spirits share ancient wisdom. Others just get mad you touched their stuff.

cards.name: Grinning Ignus
cards.text: {R}, Return Grinning Ignus to its owner's hand: Add {C}{C}{R}. Activate this ability only any time you could cast a sorcery.
cards.flavor: On rare occasions, a Prismari student will summon an elemental that shows such promise that it's permitted to stay and enroll.

cards.name: Hall Monitor
cards.text:
Haste
{1}{R}, {T}: Target creature can't block this turn.
cards.flavor: "No unauthorized summoning. No writing in the library books. And absolutely no indoor dueling!"

cards.name: Heated Debate
cards.text:
This spell can't be countered. (This includes by the ward ability.)
Heated Debate deals 4 damage to target creature or planeswalker.
cards.flavor: "While you were wasting time with abstract equations, I mastered ancient Oggyar fire magic. Your move."

cards.name: Igneous Inspiration
cards.text:
Igneous Inspiration deals 3 damage to any target.
Learn. (You may reveal a Lesson card you own from outside the game and put it into your hand, or discard a card to draw a card.)
cards.flavor: Prismari fosters a burning need to create.

cards.name: Illuminate History
cards.text: Discard any number of cards, then draw that many cards. Then if there are seven or more cards in your graveyard, create a 3/2 red and white Spirit creature token.
cards.flavor: "Look at the detail in this stonework! Professor, our assumptions about early Kathorran tool use may not be correct."

cards.name: Illustrious Historian
cards.text: {5}, Exile Illustrious Historian from your graveyard: Create a tapped 3/2 red and white Spirit creature token.
cards.flavor: The most distinguished Lorehold professors are eligible to receive extended tenure, even beyond the limits of their own mortality.

cards.name: Mascot Interception
cards.text:
This spell costs {3} less to cast if it targets a creature token.
Gain control of target creature until end of turn. Untap that creature. It gets +2/+0 and gains haste until end of turn.
cards.flavor: Far from the trappings of royalty, Rowan and Will found inspiration from the most popular sport on campus, Mage Tower.

cards.name: Pigment Storm
cards.text: Pigment Storm deals 5 damage to target creature. Excess damage is dealt to that creature's controller instead.
cards.flavor: When art projects collapse, Prismari students revel in the beauty of destruction. Everyone else run for cover.

cards.name: Pillardrop Warden
cards.text:
Reach
{2}, {T}, Sacrifice Pillardrop Warden: Return target instant or sorcery card from your graveyard to your hand. Activate only as a sorcery.
cards.flavor: A giant statue of a dwarf is still a giant statue.

cards.name: Retriever Phoenix
cards.text:
Flying, haste
When Retriever Phoenix enters the battlefield, if you cast it, learn. (You may reveal a Lesson card you own from outside the game and put it into your hand, or discard a card to draw a card.)
As long as Retriever Phoenix is in your graveyard, if you would learn, you may instead return Retriever Phoenix to the battlefield.

cards.name: Start from Scratch
cards.text:
Choose one -
• Start from Scratch deals 1 damage to any target.
• Destroy target artifact.
cards.flavor: "I don't care what they think!" Rootha snapped. "I know I can do better."

cards.name: Storm-Kiln Artist
cards.text:
Storm-Kiln Artist gets +1/+0 for each artifact you control.
Magecraft - Whenever you cast or copy an instant or sorcery spell, create a Treasure token.
cards.flavor: A captured elemental makes for a potent, albeit unstable, power source.

cards.name: Sudden Breakthrough
cards.text:
Target creature gets +2/+0 and gains first strike until end of turn.
Create a Treasure token. (It's an artifact with "{T}, Sacrifice this artifact: Add one mana of any color.")
cards.flavor: Rootha created constantly, passionately, in hopes of impressing her greatest critic: herself.

cards.name: Tome Shredder
cards.text:
Haste
{T}, Exile an instant or sorcery card from your graveyard: Put a +1/+1 counter on Tome Shredder.
cards.flavor:
"Quintorius, would you care to explain why you didn't complete your homework?"
-Augusta, Lorehold dean

cards.name: Twinscroll Shaman
cards.text: Double strike
cards.flavor: "May your wretched name never grace the annals of history, you ignorant buffoon!"

cards.name: Accomplished Alchemist
cards.text:
{T}: Add one mana of any color.
{T}: Add X mana of any one color, where X is the amount of life you gained this turn.
cards.flavor: "Tincture of murkroot and lizard feet? Simple. One that doesn't take like murkroot and lizard feet? I'm working on it."

cards.name: Basic Conjuration
cards.text: Look at the top six cards of your library. You may reveal a creature card from among them and put it into your hand. Put the rest on the bottom of your library in a random order. You gain 3 life.
cards.flavor: "I made that! It's mine! Did you see that?"

cards.name: Bayou Groff
cards.text: As an additional cost to cast this spell, sacrifice a creature or pay {3}.
cards.flavor:
"Groffs are great for tracking pests through the muck, but securing the pests before the groff devours them is a dicey endeavor."
-Lisette, Witherbloom dean

cards.name: Big Play
cards.text: Target creature gets +2/+2 and gains reach until end of turn. Put a +1/+1 counter on it.
cards.flavor:
"Quandrix is running out of time. If they're going to capture the Witherbloom mascot, they need something big here."
-Cremik, Mage Tower commentator

cards.name: Bookwurm
cards.text:
Trample
When Bookwurm enters the battlefield, you gain 3 life and draw a card.
{2}{G}: Put Bookwurm from your graveyard into your library third from the top.
cards.flavor: It takes "devouring a book in one sitting" to a frightening extreme.

cards.name: Charge Through
cards.text:
Target creature gains trample until end of turn.
Draw a card.
cards.flavor:
"What a move! Lorehold gets caught flat-footed, and Witherbloom barrels ahead."
-Cremik, Mage Tower commentator

cards.name: Containment Breach
cards.text: Destroy target artifact or enchantment. If its mana value is 2 or less, create a 1/1 black and green Pest creature token with "When this creature dies, you gain 1 life."
cards.flavor: For pest keepers, there's no sound more disheartening than breaking glass.

cards.name: Devouring Tendrils
cards.text: Target creature you control deals damage equal to its power to target creature or planeswalker you don't control. When the permanent you don't control dies this turn, you gain 2 life.
cards.flavor: Witherbloom spells often take on the appearance-and personality-of their components.

cards.name: Dragonsguard Elite
cards.text:
Magecraft - Whenever you cast or copy an instant or sorcery spell, put a +1/+1 counter on Dragonsguard Elite.
{4}{G}{G}: Double the number of +1/+1 counters on Dragonsguard Elite.
cards.flavor: "The Founder Dragons brought the Blood Age to an end. It is an honor to serve them."

cards.name: Ecological Appreciation
cards.text: Search your library and graveyard for up to four creature cards with different names that each have mana value X or less and reveal them. An opponent choses two of those cards. Shuffle the chosen cards into your library and put the rest onto the battlefield. Exile Ecological Appreciation.

cards.name: Emergent Sequence
cards.text: Search your library for a basic land card, put it onto the battlefield tapped, then shuffle. That land becomes a 0/0 green and blue Fractal creature that's still a land. Put a +1/+1 counter on it for each land you had enter the battlefield under your control this turn.

cards.name: Exponential Growth
cards.text: Until end of turn, double target creature's power X times.
cards.flavor: Most Quandrix students fundamentally disagree with the concept of "enough."

cards.name: Field Trip
cards.text:
Search your library for a basic Forest card, put that card onto the battlefield tapped, then shuffle.
Learn. (You may reveal a Lesson card you own from outside the game and put it into your hand, or discard a card to draw a card.)

cards.name: Fortifying Draught
cards.text: You gain 2 life. Target creature gets +X/+X until end of turn, where X is the amount of life you gained this turn.
cards.flavor: "If a seedling can push through solid stone, there's no limit to what I could do."

cards.name: Gnarled Professor
cards.text:
Trample
When Gnarled Professor enters the battlefield, learn. (You may reveal a Lesson card you own from outside the game and put it into your hand, or discard a card to draw a card.)
cards.flavor: "Class is in season."

cards.name: Honor Troll
cards.text:
Vigilance
If you would gain life, you gain that much life plus 1 instead.
Honor Troll gets +2/+1 as long as you have 25 or more life.
cards.flavor: First in his clan to attend Strixhaven, and now first in his class.

cards.name: Karok Wrangler
cards.text: Magecraft - Whenever you cast or copy an instant or sorcery spell, put a +1/+1 counter on target creature you control.
cards.flavor:
"She showed up to class on a what?"
-Valentin, Witherbloom Dean

cards.name: Leyline Invocation
cards.text: Create a 0/0 green and blue Fractal creature token. Put X +1/+1 counters on it, where X is the number of lands you control.
cards.flavor:
"Do you still believe my work is nothing but dry, boring equations?"
-Cairu, Quandrix mage-student

cards.name: Mage Duel
cards.text:
This spell costs {2} less to cast if you've cast another instant or sorcery spell this turn.
Target creature you control gets +1/+2 until end of turn. Then it fights target creature you don't control. (Each deals damage equal to its power to the other.)
cards.flavor: "Remember the rules. No spells to the face!"

cards.name: Master Symmetrist
cards.text:
Reach
Whenever a creature you control with power equal to its toughness attacks, it gains trample until end of turn.
cards.flavor: Tondo lost his very first duel and has spent his entire life trying to get even.

cards.name: Overgrown Arch
cards.text:
Defender
{T}: You gain 1 life.
{2}, Sacrifice Overgrown Arch: Learn. (You may reveal a Lesson card you own from outside the game and put it into your hand, or discard a card to draw a card.)

cards.name: Professor of Zoomancy
cards.text: When Professor of Zoomancy enters the battlefield, create a 1/1 black and green Pest creature token with "When this creature dies, you gain 1 life."
cards.flavor: She's brilliant, if a bit overbearing.

cards.name: Reckless Amplimancer
cards.text: {4}{G}: Double Reckless Amplimancer's power and toughness until end of turn.
cards.flavor: "Linear growth? What am I, a first-year?"

cards.name: Scurrid Colony
cards.text:
Reach
Scurrid Colony gets +2/+2 as long as you control eight or more lands.
cards.flavor: Scurrid teeth evolved to crack open notes, but they work was well for crushing bones if the nest is threatened.

cards.name: Spined Karok
cards.flavor:
"The bogs are deeper than you realize. Most of the space beneath the surface is taken up by these enormous karoks. You might think your feet are touching the bottom. They're probably not."
-Gyome, Witherbloom chef

cards.name: Springmane Cervin
cards.text: When Springmane Cervin enters the battlefield, you gain 2 life.
cards.flavor: Cervins feed on the mana-rich plants around the star arches, imbuing their bodies with extraordinary grace and vitality.

cards.name: Tangletrap
cards.text:
Choose one -
• Tangletrap deals 5 damage to target creature with flying.
• Destroy target artifact.
cards.flavor:
"It's like that old saying: what goes up . . . feeds the arboretum."
-Lisette, Witherbloom dean

cards.name: Verdant Mastery
cards.text:
You may pay {3}{G} rather than pay this spell's mana cost.
Search your library for up to four basic land cards and reveal them. Put one of them onto the battlefield tapped under an opponent's control if the {3}{G} cost was paid. Put two of them onto the battlefield tapped under your control and the rest into your hand. Then shuffle.

cards.name: Augmenter Pugilist
cards.text:
Trample
As long as you control eight or more lands, Augmenter Pugilist gets +5/+5.
cards.flavor: "Hold still. I have a theory about what's about to happen to your face."

cards.name: Echoing Equation
cards.text: Choose target creature you control. Each other creature you control becomes a copy of it until end of turn, except those creatures aren't legendary if the chosen creature is legendary.
cards.flavor: "Any good experiment is repeatable."

cards.name: Blex, Vexing Pest
cards.text:
Other Pests, Bats, Insects, Snakes, and Spiders you control get +1/+1.
When Blex, Vexing Pest dies, you gain 4 life.
cards.flavor: Pests are typically harvested before they outgrow their enclosures. Blex is far from typical.

cards.name: Search for Blex
cards.text: Look at the top five cards of your library. You may put any number of them into your hand and the rest into your graveyard. You lose 3 life for each card put into your hand this way.

cards.name: Extus, Oriq Overlord
cards.text:
Double strike
Magecraft - Whenever you cast or copy an instant or sorcery spell, return target nonlegendary creature card from your graveyard to your hand.
cards.flavor: "Join me for the dawn of a new age."

cards.name: Awaken the Blood Avatar
cards.text:
As an additional cost to cast this spell, you may sacrifice any number of creatures. This spell costs {2} less to cast for each creature sacrificed this way.
Each opponent sacrifices a creature. Create a 3/6 black and red Avatar creature token with haste and "Whenever this creature attacks, it deals 3 damage to each opponent."

cards.name: Flamescroll Celebrant
cards.text:
Whenever an opponent activates an ability that isn't a mana ability, Flamescroll Celebrant deals 1 damage to that player.
{1}{R}: Flamescroll Celebrant gets +2/+0 until end of turn.
cards.flavor: "Stand up and fight!"

cards.name: Revel in Silence
cards.text:
You opponents can't cast spells or activate planeswalkers' loyalty abilities this turn.
Exile Revel in Silence.
cards.flavor: "Sit down and listen."

cards.name: Jadzi, Oracle of Arcavios
cards.text:
Discard a card: Return Jadzi, Oracle of Arcavios to its owner's hand.
Magecraft - Whenever you cast or copy an instant or sorcery spell, reveal the top card of your library. If it's a nonland card, you may cast it by paying {1} rather than paying its mana cost. If it's a land card, put it onto the battlefield.

cards.name: Journey to the Oracle
cards.text: You may put any number of land cards from your hand onto the battlefield. Then if you control eight or more lands, you may discard a card. If you do, return Journey to the Oracle to it owner's hand.
cards.flavor: To find Jadzi, one need only wander.

cards.name: Kianne, Dean of Substance
cards.text:
{T}: Exile the top card of your library. If it's a land card, put it into your hand. Otherwise, put a study counter on it.
{4}{G}: Create a 0/0 green and blue Fractal creature token. Put a +1/+1 counter on it for each different mana value among nonland cards you own in exile with study counters on them.

cards.name: Imbraham, Dean of Theory
cards.text:
Flying
{X}{U}{U}, {T}: Exile the top X cards of your library and put a study counter on each of them. Then you may put a card you own in exile with a study counter on it into your hand.

cards.name: Mila, Crafty Companion
cards.text:
Whenever an opponent attacks one or more planeswalkers you control, put a loyalty counter on each planeswalker you control.
Whenever a permanent you control becomes the target of a spell or ability and opponent controls, you may draw a card.

cards.name: Lukka, Wayward Bonder
cards.text:
[+1]: You may discard a card. If you do, draw a card. If a creature card was discarded this way, draw two cards instead.
[−2]: Return target creature card from your graveyard to the battlefield. It gains haste. Exile it at the beginning of your next upkeep.
[−7]: You get an emblem with "Whenever a creature enters the battlefield under your control, it deals damage equal to its power to any target."

cards.name: Pestilent Cauldron
cards.text:
{T}, Discard a card: Create a 1/1 black and green Pest creature token with "When this creature dies, you gain 1 life."
{1}, {T}: Each opponent mills cards equal to the amount of life you gained this turn.
{4}, {T}: Exile four target cards from a single graveyard. Draw a card.

cards.name: Restorative Burst
cards.text: Return up to two target creature, land, and/or planeswalker cards from your graveyard to your hand. Each player gains 4 life. Exile Restorative Burst.
cards.flavor: "Death? Everyone does death. Let me show you something actually impressive."

cards.name: Plargg, Dean of Chaos
cards.text:
{T}, Discard a card: Draw a card.
{4}{R}, {T}: Reveal cards from the top of your library until you reveal a nonlegendary, nonland card with mana value 3 or less. You may cast that card without paying its mana cost. Put all revealed cards not cast this way on the bottom of your library in a random order.

cards.name: Augusta, Dean of Order
cards.text:
Other tapped creatures you control get +1/+0.
Other untapped creatures you control get +0/+1.
Whenever you attack, untap each creature you control, then tap any number of creatures you control.

cards.name: Rowan, Scholar of Sparks
cards.text:
Instant and sorcery spells you cast cost {1} less to cast.
[+1]: Rowan, Scholar of Sparks deals 1 damage to each opponent. If you've drawn three or more cards this turn, she deals 3 damage to each opponent instead.
[−4]: You get an emblem with "Whenever you cast an instant or sorcery spell, you may pay {2}. If you do, copy that spell. You may choose new targets for the copy."

cards.name: Will, Scholar of Frost
cards.text:
Instant and sorcery spells you cast cost {1} less to cast.
[+1]: Up to one target creature has base power and toughness 0/2 until your next turn.
[−3]: Draw two cards.
[−7]: Exile up to five target permanents. For each permanent exiled this way, its controller creates a 4/4 blue and red Elemental Creature token.

cards.name: Selfless Glyphweaver
cards.text: Exile Selfless Glyphweaver: Creatures you control gain indestructible until end of turn.
cards.flavor: He offered his light to make sure no others would be dimmed.

cards.name: Deadly Vanity
cards.text: Choose a creature or planeswalker, then destroy all other creatures and planeswalkers.
cards.flavor: She cast a spell to purge all weakness. When the ink cleared, she stood alone.

cards.name: Shaile, Dean of Radiance
cards.text:
Flying, vigilance
{T}: Put a +1/+1 counter on each creature that entered the battlefield under your control this turn.
cards.flavor: "You are so much stronger than you know."

cards.name: Embrose, Dean of Shadow
cards.text:
{T}: Put a +1/+1 counter on another target creature, then Embrose, Dean of Shadow deals 2 damage to that creature.
Whenever a creature you control with a +1/+1 counter on it dies, draw a card.

cards.name: Torrent Sculptor
cards.text:
Ward {2} (Whenever this creature becomes the target of a spell or ability an opponent controls, counter it unless that player pays {2}.)
When Torrent Sculptor enters the battlefield, exile an instant or sorcery card from your graveyard. Put a number of +1/+1 counters on Torrent Sculptor equal to half that card's mana value, rounded up.

cards.name: Flamethrower Sonata
cards.text: Discard a card, then draw a card. When you discard an instant or sorcery card this way, Flamethrower Sonata deals damage equal to that card's mana value to target creature or planeswalker you don't control.
cards.flavor: He channels his heart's passion into every fiery note.

cards.name: Uvilda, Dean of Perfection
cards.text: {T}: You may exile an instant or sorcery card from your hand and put three hone counters on it. It gains "At the beginning of your upkeep, if this card is exiled, remove a hone counter from it" and "When the last hone counter is removed from this card, if it's exiled, you may cast it. It costs {4} less to cast this way."

cards.name: Nassari, Dean of Expression
cards.text:
At the beginning of your upkeep, exile the top card of each opponent's library. Until end of turn, you may cast spells from among those exiled cards, and you many spend mana as though it were mana of any color to cast those spells.
Whenever you cast a spell from exile, put a +1/+1 counter on Nassari, Dean of Expression.

cards.name: Valentin, Dean of the Vein
cards.text:
Menace, lifelink
If a nontoken creature an opponent controls would die, exile it instead. When you do, you may pay {2}. If you do, create a 1/1 black and green Pest creature token with "When this creature dies, you gain 1 life."

cards.name: Lisette, Dean of the Root
cards.text: Whenever you gain life, you may pay {1}. If you do, put a +1/+1 counter on each creature you control and those creatures gain trample until end of turn.
cards.flavor: "Life is as fleeting as it is vibrant. Embrace the brief blessing of a flower before it withers."

cards.name: Aether Helix
cards.text: Return target permanent to its owner's hand. Return target permanent card from your graveyard to your hand.
cards.flavor: Some Quandrix mages prefer to study at twilight, watching their experimental equations trace glowing trails against the encroaching darkness.

cards.name: Beledros Witherbloom
cards.text:
Flying
At the beginning of each upkeep, create a 1/1 black and green Pest creature token with "When this creature dies, you gain 1 life."
Pay 10 life: Untap all lands you control. Activate only once each turn.

cards.name: Biomathematician
cards.text: When Biomathematician enters the battlefield, create a 0/0 green and blue Fractal creature token. Put a +1/+1 counter on each Fractal you control.
cards.flavor: "I will reach infinity."

cards.name: Blade Historian
cards.text: Attacking creatures you control have double strike.
cards.flavor: "So you see, the reckless battle strategy of the Kathorran orcs was effective, but ultimately proved to be a double-edged sword. As did their double-edged swords.

cards.name: Blood Researcher
cards.text:
Menace (This creature can't be blocked except by two or more creatures.)
Whenever you gain life, put a +1/+1 counter on Blood Researcher.
cards.flavor: "Dean Valentin warns us not to consume the samples for our safety, but I think he's just being greedy."

cards.name: Blot Out the Sky
cards.text: Create X tapped 2/1 white and black Inkling creature tokens with flying. If X is 6 or more, destroy all noncreature, nonland permanents.
cards.flavor: A drop of ink is a nuisance. A torrent of inklings is a menace.

cards.name: Body of Research
cards.text: Create a 0/0 green and blue Fractal creature token. Put X +1/+1 counters on it, where X is the number of cards in your library.
cards.flavor: Needledeep had promised that his final project would be his biggest one yet.

cards.name: Closing Statement
cards.text:
This spell costs {2} less to cast during your end step.
Destroy target creature or planeswalker you don't control. Put a +1/+1 counter on up to one target creature you control.
cards.flavor: "In conclusion . . ."

cards.name: Cram Session
cards.text:
You gain 4 life.
Learn. (You may reveal a Lesson card you own from outside the game and put it into your hand, or discard a card to draw a card.)
cards.flavor: The only thing more delicious than a top grade is Gyome's signature cake.

cards.name: Creative Outburst
cards.text:
Creative Outburst deals 5 damage to any target. Look at the top five cards of your library. Put one of them into your hand and the rest on the bottom of your library in a random order.
{U/R}{U/R}, Discard Creative Outburst: Create a Treasure token.

cards.name: Culling Ritual
cards.text: Destroy each nonland permanent with mana value 2 or less. Add {B} or {G} for each permanent destroyed this way.
cards.flavor: "Your own frailty is your undoing. I am merely the one to expose it."

cards.name: Culmination of Studies
cards.text: Exile the top X cards of your library. For each land card exiled this way, create a Treasure token. For each blue card exiled this way, draw a card. For each red card exiled this way, Culmination of Studies deals 1 damage to each opponent.
cards.flavor: Will's quick thinking meshed with Rowan's raw power to bring down the Blood Avatar.

cards.name: Daemogoth Titan
cards.text: Whenever Daemogoth Titan attacks or blocks, sacrifice a creature.
cards.flavor:
"Of course it offered you power. Demons always do. But trust me-the sweeter the prize, the more ruinous the price."
-Professor Onyx

cards.name: Daemogoth Woe-Eater
cards.text:
At the beginning of your upkeep, sacrifice a creature.
When you sacrifice Daemogoth Woe-Eater, each opponent discards a card, you draw a card, and you gain 2 life.
cards.flavor: "Your pain for my wisdom. You'll get no better deal."

cards.name: Deadly Brew
cards.text: Each player sacrifices a creature or planeswalker. If you sacrificed a permanent this way, you may return another permanent card from your graveyard to your hand.
cards.flavor: No one ever asked what was in Dina's concoctions, so long as they worked.

cards.name: Decisive Denial
cards.text:
Choose one -
• Target creature you control fights target creature you don't control. (Each deals damage equal to its power to the other.)
• Counter target noncreature spell unless its controller pays {3}.
cards.flavor: "I've heard enough."

cards.name: Dina, Soul Steeper
cards.text:
Whenever you gain life, each opponent loses 1 life.
{1}, Sacrifice another creature: Dina, Soul Steeper gets +X/+0 until end of turn, where X is the sacrificed creature's power.

cards.name: Double Major
cards.text: Copy target creature spell you control, except it isn't legendary if the spell is legendary. (A copy of a creature spell becomes a token.)
cards.flavor: "Now I can dedicate myself fully to zoetimancy and void theory!"

cards.name: Dramatic Finale
cards.text:
Creature tokens you control get +1/+1.
Whenever one or more nontoken creatures you control die, create a 2/1 white and black Inkling creature token with flying. This ability triggers only once each turn.
cards.flavor: The enraptured audience barely noticed their programs were suddenly blank.

cards.name: Elemental Expressionist
cards.text: Magecraft - Whenever you cast or copy an instant or sorcery spell, choose target creature you control. Until end of turn, it gains "If this creature would leave the battlefield, exile it instead of putting it anywhere else" and "When you exile this creature, create a 4/4 blue and red Elemental creature token." (Each instance of that ability triggers separately.)

cards.name: Elemental Masterpiece
cards.text:
Create two 4/4 blue and red Elemental creature tokens.
{U/R}{U/R}, Discard Elemental Masterpiece: Create a Treasure token. (It's an artifact with "{T}, Sacrifice this artifact: Add one mana of any color.")
cards.flavor: Rootha passed with flying, living colors.

cards.name: Elemental Summoning
cards.text: Create a 4/4 blue and red Elemental creature token.
cards.flavor:
"You've made a splash. Now show me a torrent."
-Uvilda, Prismari dean

cards.name: Eureka Moment
cards.text: Draw two cards. You may put a land card from your hand onto the battlefield.
cards.flavor: "At first, the equations were simply numbers. But in those numbers, I saw a story, and in that story I saw a pattern, and suddenly it all fit together!"

cards.name: Exhilarating Elocution
cards.text: Put two +1/+1 counters on target creature you control. Other creatures you control get +1/+1 until end of turn.
cards.flavor: His words poured forth on waves of golden light, scouring all fear from his audience's hearts and minds.

cards.name: Expressive Iteration
cards.text: Look at the top three cards of your library. Put one of them into your hand, put one of them on the bottom of your library, and exile one of them. You may play the exiled card this turn.
cards.flavor: Prismari students dance in the tension between passion and perfection.

cards.name: Fractal Summoning
cards.text: Create a 0/0 green and blue Fractal creature token. Put X +1/+1 counters on it.
cards.flavor:
"Fractals are just pseudo-dimensional manifestations of asynchronous biosymmetries. It's really quite simple."
-Kianne, Quandrix dean

cards.name: Fracture
cards.text: Destroy target artifact, enchantment, or planeswalker.
cards.flavor:
"Your defiance is amusing, little mage. It's time you learn how fragile you really are."
-Extus Narr

cards.name: Galazeth Prismari
cards.text:
Flying
When Galazeth Prismari enters the battlefield, create a Treasure token.
